programme.title: Real Sociedad vs Atlético de Madrid - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18
programme.desc: Atlético de Madrid are unbeaten in their last 11 LaLiga matches against Real Sociedad, since a 2-0 defeat in September 2019, their longest unbeaten streak against the Txuri-Urdin in the competition since April 1976. Real Sociedad have failed to beat Atlético de Madrid at home in LaLiga in their last five attempts, scoring only three goals in this period – this is their current longest winless home run against any side currently in the competition.

programme.title: Real Sociedad vs Atlético de Madrid - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18
programme.desc: Atlético de Madrid are unbeaten in their last 11 LaLiga matches against Real Sociedad, since a 2-0 defeat in September 2019, their longest unbeaten streak against the Txuri-Urdin in the competition since April 1976. Real Sociedad have failed to beat Atlético de Madrid at home in LaLiga in their last five attempts, scoring only three goals in this period – this is their current longest winless home run against any side currently in the competition.

programme.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979 and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

programme.title: PSG vs Paris FC - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17- Mini Match
programme.desc: Two clubs from the Paris region will face each other for the first time in Ligue 1 since 25 February 1990, when Paris SG met Racing Paris. If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

programme.desc: All 380 matches from the English Premier league are live and exclusive only on beIN. All matches are available live with a choice of Arabic or English commentary. The season will consist of 33 weekends and five midweek rounds of matches. Liverpool are the defending champions, having won their second Premier League title.

programme.title: PSG vs Paris FC - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17
programme.desc: Two clubs from the Paris region will face each other for the first time in Ligue 1 since 25 February 1990, when Paris SG met Racing Paris. If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

programme.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979 and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

programme.title: MA Super Ligue 1
programme.desc: The magazine takes children inside French football with player meet-ups, Dan interviews experienced FC Metz player, Benjamin Stambouli, Thilo Kehrer and George Ilenikhena join a game of 1, 2, 3 football and OGC Nice captain, Dante, tries his hand at being a taxi driver!

programme.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979 and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

programme.title: Manchester City vs. Chelsea - English Premier League 2026/2027
programme.desc: Each of Cole Palmer’s last nine Premier League goals for Chelsea have been scored in London. He’s not scored outside of the capital since December 2024, while he’s not scored north of London since August 2024. Erling Haaland has scored 11 goals in eight Premier League home games for Man City this season, netting twice in five different games. The last player to score 2+ goals in more different home games in a season was Haaland himself in 2022-23.

programme.title: Manchester City vs Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 20
programme.desc: All 380 matches from the English Premier league are live and exclusive only on beIN. All matches are available live with a choice of Arabic or English commentary. The season will consist of 33 weekends and five midweek rounds of matches. Liverpool are the defending champions, having won their second Premier League title.

programme.title: PSG vs Paris FC - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17
programme.desc: Two clubs from the Paris region will face each other for the first time in Ligue 1 since 25 February 1990, when Paris SG met Racing Paris. If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

programme.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979 and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Real Betis - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18
programme.desc: Real Madrid lost their last La Liga game against Real Betis, 2-1 in March 2025, after having been unbeaten in their previous nine encounters. They have not lost two consecutive league games against Real Betis since 1999. Real Madrid have won just two of their last eight home games against Real Betis, failing to score in six of those matches – they have failed to score in six home games against the Verdiblancos in LaLiga since the 2017/18 season, at least two more than against any other opponent.

programme.title: PSG vs Paris FC - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17- Mini Match
programme.desc: Two clubs from the Paris region will face each other for the first time in Ligue 1 since 25 February 1990, when Paris SG met Racing Paris. If Racing are considered being based in Colombes, this will be the first Ligue 1 match between two clubs from the same city since Paris SG-Paris FC on 17 December 1978. This will be the third meeting in all competitions between Paris Saint-Germain and Paris FC, following two draws in Ligue 1 in 1978. Paris Saint-Germain have not lost any of their last 38 home games against a promoted side in Ligue 1, with their last defeat coming against Montpellier on 15 May 2010.

programme.title: Marseille vs Nantes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17
programme.desc: Marseille have won eight of their last 10 Ligue 1 matches against Nantes, as many wins as they managed in their previous 27 encounters. This is their longest unbeaten run against FCN in their history. Marseille have won their last five Ligue 1 home games against Nantes, scoring at least two goals each time. They have also scored in their last 11 home meetings with FCN in the competition.

programme.title: Lorient vs Metz - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 17
programme.desc: Lorient have won 56% of their Ligue 1 matches against Metz, their highest win ratio against an opponent faced at least ten times in the top-flight. Lorient have lost just one of their eight home Ligue 1 matches against Metz, but that sole defeat came in their last encounter on 26 November 2023. programme.title: Shanghai Port FC (CHN) vs FC Seoul (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD5
programme.desc: Shanghai Port have won each of their two meetings with FC Seoul at the AFC Champions League Elite, with an aggregate score of 5-2; however, Shanghai Port are winless in each of their last nine games in the competition. FC Seoul have failed to score in each of their last two games at the AFC Champions League Elite, after scoring in 13 consecutive games prior to that; the last and the only time they went on a longer run without a goal was a stretch of five games between August 2014 and February 2015.

programme.title: Ulsan HD FC (KOR) vs Buriram United (THA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD5

programme.title: Al Duhail SC (QAT) vs Al Ittihad Club (KSA) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD5

programme.title: Al Ahli Saudi FC (KSA) vs Sharjah FC (UAE) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD5

programme.desc: Al-Hilal have won each of their three meetings with Al Shorta at AFC Champions League Elite, keeping clean sheets in each of the last two; Al Shorta have won just one of their 10 meetings against sides from Saudi Arabia – a 2-1 win against Al-Ahli on 17 September 2020. programme.title: Espanyol vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 18
programme.desc: Espanyol have not won any of their last 28 LaLiga games against Barcelona. Only two teams have gone 29 or more consecutive matches without a win against the same opponent in the competition's history: Real Sociedad against Real Madrid between 1957 and 1979 and Hércules also against Real Madrid between 1940 and 1984. FC Barcelona are unbeaten in their last 16 away LaLiga games against Espanyol, since a 3-1 defeat in January 2007 at the Lluís Companys. This run is only surpassed by Villarreal as their longest away unbeaten streak against the same opponent in the competition's history.

programme.title: Lorenzo MUSETTI (ITA) vs Carlos ALCARAZ (ESP) - Final Rolex Monte Carlo Masters - ATP 1000 - Monaco
programme.desc: In the 2025 Monte Carlo Masters final, No. 2 seed Carlos Alcaraz meets Lorenzo Musetti in a high-stakes clay-court clash. Alcaraz, chasing his first Monte Carlo title, reached his seventh Masters 1000 final after defeating Davidovich Fokina. Musetti, now the third Italian to reach this final in the Open Era, earned his spot by edging past Alex de Minaur. Alcaraz leads their head-to-head 3–1, with Musetti’s lone win coming on clay in Hamburg (2022).

programme.title: Gemma Triay Pons (Esp) Delfina Brea Senesi (Arg) vs Marta Ortega Gallego (Esp) Tamara Icardo Alcoris
programme.desc: Roland-Garros, Philippe-Chatrier. New World No.1s Gemma Triay/Delfi Brea meet Marta Ortega/Tamara Icardo with the Paris crown and 2,000 FIP points at stake. Triay/Brea reached the final after outlasting Ustero/Araujo; Ortega/Icardo ousted Sánchez/Josemaría in a statement win. programme.title: Final's - Arab Elite Tennis Championship - 2025
programme.desc: 5th Arab Tennis Elite Tournament – Manama, Bahrain concludes with the Singles Final as Mohammad Al Qutb (Jordan) meets Aziz Al Waqaa (Tunisia) on the hard courts of the Public Security Officers Club. programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Alexander Zverev (GER) -Men's Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian O
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open men’s singles final sees defending champion and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner taking on World No. 2 Alexander Zverev. Sinner chases his third Grand Slam title after dominating Ben Shelton in the semifinals. Zverev, still in search of his first Grand Slam title, advanced after Novak Djokovic retired due to injury. A thrilling battle unfolds, with Sinner’s aggressive play clashing against Zverev’s powerful serves and groundstrokes.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Madison Keys (USA) - Women's Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian Open
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka faces Madison Keys in the Australian Open women’s singles final. Sabalenka, the World No. 1, dominates their head-to-head 4-1 and looks unstoppable on Rod Laver Arena, riding a 20-match winning streak. Keys, ranked 19th, delivers a stunning run, defeating top seeds, including Iga Swiatek, with improved form under her husband-coach Bjorn Fratangelo. A clash of power and precision unfolds as they battle for the title.

programme.title: Toulouse vs Nimes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: AFCON Morocco 2025 Show
programme.desc: The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations, commonly known as AFCON 2025, marks the 35th edition of this prestigious biennial tournament organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF). This edition will be hosted by Morocco for the second time, following its previous hosting in 1988. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the AFCON Morcco 2025 on beIN Sports News.

programme.title: Football Legends - News
programme.desc: In the world of sports, few debates ignite passion and enthusiasm quite like the discussion surrounding the greatest football players of all time. This topic transcends generations, cultures, and nationalities, as fans passionately defend their favorites and recount unforgettable moments on the pitch. From legendary goal scorers to masterful playmakers, the players who have left an indelible mark on the game deserve recognition and celebration. " Football Legends" explore the remarkable careers and contributions of these iconic players who have shaped the beautiful game.
